title: (x) Fitness Concepts logo- Blockit {Sebastian}
content:
Hi,

Can anybody help my ID the font used in this logo? Think it's a bold and regular version of the same font (just a guess).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092406im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fitness-logo_5738.gif)
author: tasty_cookie

comments.content:
Well, this looks like one of those myriads of free-fonts to me. Apologies if it isn't.  
Haven't found an exact match. But if I would have to redo the logo I'd started with various weights of [Karnivore](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092406/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=karnivore&page=1&nb_ppp_old=50&text=FITNESS+CONCEPT&nb_ppp=50&af=on&classt=alpha) from apostrophic Labs.

this is a free font called Blockit that comes in 3 weights Thin, Normal, Bold. It used to be available at fontomas.com in 2003 - but i can't find it on the web anywhere...

maybe you can email them?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092406im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blockit_5149.png)

(edit: after a little research i found out that you can purchase a CD containing all Fontomas fonts at [http://www.typetype.net/cat/fontomas.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092406/http:/www.typetype.net/cat/fontomas.html "http://www.typetype.net/cat/fontomas.html"))
Looks like a perfect match! Thank's SO much! :-)
